page.title: 04FARMING NOW AND THEN
page.content: { }In{1945}my Grandad worked for Mr Hawkins at Southfield farm. He worked 7am.to 5.30pm.and half day Saturdays. His pay was 2p per hour. The 300 acre farm had 30 cows ,12 pigs ,170 sheep, 8 horses,200 hens,60 cattle.It grew wheat,barley,oats,clover,and roots. With his Clydesdales he could plough a 20 acre field in 20 days.He enjoyed hedging but he didn't like building the high stacks.The first tractor came in 1938.His work was hard, and long but it was very varied. { Now}my Grandad works for John Walkup at Church Farm.His hours are 8.00am.to 5.30pm. They have 4 tractors and 1 forklift. The 500 acre farm has 450 pigs and 87-cows.They grow peas,rape, barley,wheat and grass. In the last 40 years Grandad has seen many changes. He misses working with horses but he prefers combining today.
